intro: Coussapoa latifolia var. obovata, commonly known as the broadleaf coussapoa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its broad, obovate leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters, adding visual interest to its appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical or subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
